entry.summary:
Vendor: Gitzell
Type: Home
Price: 30.00

This wide, handwoven basket made from natural sisal grass is ideal for holding jewelry, keys, or fruit - a perfectly stylish catchall! Hook on the back for hanging as wall decor. 

  • Color: Yellow with Dark Swirl Pattern 
  • Measures: 12.5" in diameter. 
  • Handmade by artisans in Kenya.

entry.title: Petite Olive Wood Heart Trinket Bowls - Set of 2
entry.summary:
Vendor: Jedando
Type: Kitchen
Price: 24.99

Artfully carved from a single piece of wild olive wood using simple hand tools by Kenyan artisans, these petite, rustic heart jewelry or trinket dish showcases the beautiful natural wood-grain. 

Product Features:

  • Set of 2 bowls
  • Each piece is approximately 2-inches wide by 2-inches in length by .75-inches tall.  Due to the hand-carved nature, actual size may vary slightly.
  • Hand wash only. Periodically treat wood with food-grade mineral oil or olive oil to maintain their beauty and luster.
  • Because these are made by hand using rudimentary hand tools, no two are identical and variations are to be appreciated and enjoyed by the consumer.
  • Fair Trade is so much more than a product assortment. It's about safe workplaces, fair wages + community investment for factory employees.
  • Color: Natural.
  • Ethically handmade in Kenya from sustainably sourced olive wood.

entry.title: Handmade Bone Bar Set - 2 Spoons 1 Animal Fork
entry.summary:
Vendor: Gifts With Humanity
Type: Misc
Price: 15.99

Handmade by artisans in Kenya using traditional methods passed down through the generations, these batiked bone serving utinsels are a beautiful accessory to your appetizer trays or bar area. Crafted from ethically-sourced, sanitized animal bone that is hand carved and designed by placing wax on the white bone and dipping the bone a dark brown/black dye, resulting in traditional patterns native to the Kenyan region.

entry.title: Olive Wood Appetizer Set of 3 (Fork, Spoon, Spreader)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Jedando Handicrafts
Type: Tableware
Price: 17.95

Handmade by artisans in Kenya using traditional methods passed down through the generations, these olive wood and batik handle serving utensils are a beautiful accessory to your appetizer trays or bar area. 

Product Features:

  • Hand carved and hand-painted. No two are identical.
  • Naturally water and stain resistant
  • Hand wash and air dry
  • Socially responsible goods that is empowering to consumers to purchase according to their values and help alleviate poverty. Fair trade is so much more than a product assortment. It's about safe workplaces, fair wages + community investment for factory employees.
  • Made from wood and ethically sourced animal bones that would have otherwise been discarded.
  • Each piece is approximately 6 to 7-inches long

Story Behind the Art: 

The bone is "batiked" which is an age old art process used in Africa.  The patterns are applied by placing wax on the white bone and dipping the bone into a dark brown/black dye, resulting in the beautiful African mud cloth designs.

entry.title: Hammered Steel Bowl with Round Handles, Haitian Drum Tabletop Décor, 6" x 5"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Croix des Bouquets
Type: Home decor
Price: 42.99

Crafted from recycled 55-gallon steel drums by village artisans in Haiti, these stunning pieces of art are truly one-of-a-kind! The process of turning sheets of metal into beautiful art is all done by hand. Steel drums used to transport oil into the capital of Haiti are cut, the oil is burned off to clean the metal, and then flattened in order to create stunning, upcycled art. Suitable for Indoor or Outdoor Use.  

  • Type: Metal Table Decor
  • Colors: Metallic
  • Materials: Upcycled Steel Metal
  • Finish: Lacquer
  • Dimensions: Approx. 6" x 5"
  • Care: If using outdoors it is recommended to spray with a clear lacquer once or twice a year, as prolonged exposure to the elements will cause rust.

Given the handmade nature of this product please allow for minor variations. As the metal is recovered from recycled oil drums and colored through a burning process it will vary slightly in coloration. Typically the piece has a darkened steel patina. Each piece of art is coated with a layer of clear lacquer to help protect the metal.

entry.title: Horizontal Green Guinea Fowl Batik
entry.summary:
Vendor: Tonga Textiles
Type: Misc
Price: 59.99

This piece of batiked fabric is perfect as a table runner or wall art. Handmade in Zimbabwe it measures 56 by 15 inches.

Zimbabwean artists have long been renowned for their batiks. Whether it is a wall hanging or a wallet, the brilliant patterns and intricate designs of the batik clearly illustrates the artists’ talent. Cotton material is stamped with wax and painted or dipped in dye. The dye is set in a water bath and the wax lifted from the material using boiling water and hot irons. Each piece is exquisitely handmade and reflects the quality and beauty of Zimbabwe.

entry.title: Felt Ball Trivets: Round, Ice Blue
entry.summary:
Vendor: Global Groove Direct
Type: Home
Price: 20.00

These felt trivets add texture, style and fun pops of color while protecting your dinner table. They also serve as added insulation to keep the pot hot! Handmade by women artisans in Nepal.

  • Measures approximately: 8 inches in diameter.
  • 100% All Natural New Zealand Wool.
  • Azo-free dyes.
  • Care: Spot clean as needed. Do not machine wash or dry.
  • Due to the handmade nature, slight variations in size, exact color, shape, pattern, or other characteristics may be evident. Each piece is truly a unique work of art, lovingly crafted by hand.

The Art of Felting:

The first step to creating these beautiful felt pieces begins with gathering some of the world’s finest sheep’s wool from New Zealand. Making felted wool is an ages-old, time-consuming process of bonding fabric with fiber. This is a physical job where the artisan’s scrub, rub, roll and rinse the wool again and again with soapy water.

Once the wool is bound into a sheet and the desired thickness is complete, the felt is laid out to dry. From there, the felt wool is cut and re-worked into many complex shapes and designs. The many sheets of wool might merge several colors to create patterns and layers. This takes a well-trained, talented artisan and is a true labor of love. The end results are colorful, one-of-a-kind textiles that are stunning to behold.
